information: Concerns have been raised regarding Senator Fetterman's performance and health. As of late May 2025, he had missed approximately 30 floor votes, giving him one of the lowest attendance records in the Senate. A report from Yahoo cited a 1,600-word email from Fetterman's former chief of staff, Adam Jentleson, sent to the senator's doctor in May 2024. The email detailed 'warning signs' such as reckless driving and conspiratorial thinking. Other Democratic senators have also privately expressed worries about his ability to handle the stresses of the office.

forecast.status_quo_outcome: Senator Fetterman continues to caucus with the Senate Democrats.
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: Despite public reports and concerns from colleagues about his health and performance, Senator Fetterman remains in office and continues to caucus with the Democrats through the July 1, 2025 deadline, consistent with his public statements.
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: The mounting pressure from the public revelations, combined with a potential decline in his health or a consensus within the Democratic party that he can no longer serve effectively, leads Senator Fetterman to resign from his Senate seat before July 1, 2025.
forecast.rationale: My forecast is based on the strong tendency towards the status quo in politics, especially concerning a sitting U.S. Senator's status over a very short one-month timeframe. The default assumption must be that Senator Fetterman will remain in his position and continue caucusing with the Democrats. Supporting this is Fetterman's own explicit public statement that he will not resign. Incumbents rarely leave office voluntarily, and public defiance often signals an intent to withstand political pressure. However, the probability is not zero due to the severity and nature of the concerns raised. The research report highlights a poor attendance record and, more significantly, a detailed account from a former chief of staff alleging 'warning signs' such as reckless driving and conspiratorial thinking. These are not policy disagreements but fundamental questions about his fitness for office. Such concerns make the situation more volatile than a typical political dispute and create a non-trivial chance of a rapid, unforeseen change, most likely a resignation for health reasons. My forecast is not higher because of the extremely short deadline and Fetterman's stated intent to stay. For a change to occur in just over 30 days, the situation would need to escalate dramatically, such as his health worsening significantly or Democratic leadership formally moving to push him out, both of which are high-inertia events. My forecast is not lower because the detailed, personal nature of the concerns from a trusted former aide makes this situation exceptionally serious and unpredictable. I would increase this forecast if Fetterman's family or doctor released a statement recommending he step down, or if Senate Democratic leadership publicly withdrew their support. I would decrease the forecast if his attendance in the Senate regularized or if his office provided a credible rebuttal to the recent reports.

prompt:
You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.

Your interview question is:
Will Senator John Fetterman cease caucusing with the Democrats before July 1, 2025?

Question background:
[Fetterman says he wonâ€™t resign, gets support from McCormick as article blowback continues](https://www.pennlive.com/news/2025/05/fetterman-says-he-wont-resign-gets-support-from-mccormick-as-article-blowback-continues.html) | [An isolated, angry Fetterman is yet another challenge for Democrats](https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2025/05/16/john-fetterman-senate-relationships/)


This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2025, John Fetterman ceases caucusing with the [Senate Democrats](https://www.democrats.senate.gov/about-senate-dems/our-caucus) for any reason, whether because he switches parties, resigns, or any other reason.




Your research assistant's report says:
Concerns have been raised regarding Senator Fetterman's performance and health. As of late May 2025, he had missed approximately 30 floor votes, giving him one of the lowest attendance records in the Senate. A report from Yahoo cited a 1,600-word email from Fetterman's former chief of staff, Adam Jentleson, sent to the senator's doctor in May 2024. The email detailed 'warning signs' such as reckless driving and conspiratorial thinking. Other Democratic senators have also privately expressed worries about his ability to handle the stresses of the office.

Today is 2025-05-29.

Before answering you think:
(a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
(b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
(c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
(d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
(e) You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time. Explain your reasoning and the evidence behind your forecast in detail. Summarise information your received from your research assistant that influences your forecast (if any). Explain why your forecast is not higher, and why it is not lower. Outline what would need to be true for you to update your forecast in either direction.
(f) The last thing you write is your final probabilistic forecast as a number between 0 and 100.

# OUTPUT SCHEMA
{
    "time_left_until_outcome_known": "string",
    "status_quo_outcome": "string",
    "no_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "yes_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "rationale": "string",
    "probability": "number" (0-100)
}
